what: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
title: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
Internal R for the Rest of Us package
Internal R for the Rest of Us package
text: function returns named vector colors used R Rest Us plots, elsewhere. based website: Blue - #6caadd : blue logo Dark Text - #314D63 : dark blue text colour website Light Text - #8394A1 : lighter variant dark blue text color Pale Blue - #E1EEF8 : pale blue based logo blue, currently used gridlines
code: rfortherestofus::rru_colors() ##       Blue  Dark Text Light Text  Pale Blue  ##  "#6caadd"  "#314D63"  "#8394A1"  "#E1EEF8" rfortherestofus::rru_colors("Dark Text", "Pale Blue") ## [1] "#314D63" "#E1EEF8"

title: Internal R for the Rest of Us package
text: uses font “Inter”, available via Google Fonts. Make sure install device import R making use theme.
code: library(tidyverse)  palmerpenguins::penguins %>%   ggplot() +   geom_point(aes(x = bill_length_mm,                  y = flipper_length_mm,                  color = species,                  size = body_mass_g)) +   labs(title = "Perfectly proportional penguins",        subtitle = "Just *look* at them go!",        x = "Bill length (mm)",        y = "Flipper length (mm)") +   colorblindr::scale_color_OkabeIto() +   guides(size = "none") +   rrutemplates::theme_rru() palmerpenguins::penguins %>%   ggplot(aes(x = 1,              fill = species),          stat = "count") +   geom_bar() +   xlim(c(-0.5, 2)) +   coord_polar(theta = "y") +   labs(title = "Perfectly proportional penguins",        subtitle = "Look at them go!",        caption = "Data from {palmerpenguins}") +   colorblindr::scale_fill_OkabeIto() +   rrutemplates::theme_rru(void = TRUE) +   theme(legend.position = "right",         plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

Title — number_half_up
code: number_half_up(   x,   accuracy = NULL,   scale = 1,   prefix = "",   suffix = "",   big.mark = " ",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )

title: Title — number_half_up
text: x numeric vector format. accuracy number round . Use (e.g.) 0.01 show 2 decimal places precision. NULL, default, uses heuristic ensure breaks minimum number digits needed show difference adjacent values. Applied rescaled data. scale scaling factor: x multiplied scale formating. useful underlying data small large. prefix Symbols display value. suffix Symbols display value. big.mark Character used every 3 digits separate thousands. decimal.mark character used indicate numeric decimal point. trim Logical, FALSE, values right-justified common width (see base::format()). ... arguments passed base::format().

what: Convert PDF to Animated GIF — pdf_to_gif
title: Convert PDF to Animated GIF — pdf_to_gif
Convert PDF to Animated GIF — pdf_to_gif
code: pdf_to_gif(   pdf_location,   gif_file_path = here::here(),   gif_file_name,   density = 50 )

title: Convert PDF to Animated GIF — pdf_to_gif
text: pdf_location Location PDF file gif_file_path Starts ::() gif_file_name must include .gif end density Affects file size GIF outputted

title: Percent Half_up function — percent_half_up
code: percent_half_up(   x,   accuracy = NULL,   scale = 100,   prefix = "",   suffix = "%",   big.mark = " ",   decimal.mark = ".",   trim = TRUE,   ... )

title: Percent Half_up function — percent_half_up
text: x numeric vector format. accuracy number round . Use (e.g.) 0.01 show 2 decimal places precision. NULL, default, uses heuristic ensure breaks minimum number digits needed show difference adjacent values. Applied rescaled data. scale scaling factor: x multiplied scale formating. useful underlying data small large. prefix Symbols display value. suffix Symbols display value. big.mark Character used every 3 digits separate thousands. decimal.mark character used indicate numeric decimal point. trim Logical, FALSE, values right-justified common width (see base::format()). ... arguments passed base::format().

title: Percent Half_up function — percent_half_up
text: percent function display 12% like scales::percent(125/1000, accuracy = 1) 13%

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

what: Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
title: Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
text: rru_colors() enables pull colors directly RRU palette. Choose one following options: primary colors: Blue, Dark Text, Light Text additional color: Orange, Yellow, Red

title: Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
Function to extract RRU colors as hex codes — rru_colors
text: rru_colors("Dark Text", "Light Text") returns code colors. rru_colours() returns named vector RRU hex codes

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
text: Remember install import required fonts ("Inter") using !

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
code: theme_rru(   show_grid_lines = TRUE,   show_legend = TRUE,   base_family = "Inter",   title_family = "Inter",   axis_family = "Inter",   void = FALSE )

title: RRU ggplot2 theme — theme_rru
text: show_grid_lines Boolean indicate whether grid_lines (TRUE default) show_legend Whether show legend (TRUE default) base_family Base font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. title_family Title font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. axis_family Axis text title font family (Inter default). want use custom font, need register first. void logical, use TRUE want plot use theme_void() starting point (.e. want axes)

title: Upload video to muse.ai — upload_muse_video
text: local_video Location local video video_title call video muse
